definition: to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

sentences.english: I am alone and the road is very dark.
sentences.chinese: 我踽踽独行，前路一片漆黑。

sentences.english: In the struggle to heal this nation and repair this world, we cannot walk alone.
sentences.chinese: 在完善改良我们国家的道路上，我们不能踽踽独行。

sentences.english: Romance is a snowy evening you walk back home alone with creaking footsteps.
sentences.chinese: 浪漫是飞雪的黄昏踏雪而归踽踽独行。

sentences.english: But I am helpless, traveled alone, and only dream is my only companion.
sentences.chinese: 可我无依无靠，踽踽独行，只有梦是我唯一的伴侣。

sentences.english: In the struggle for peace and justice, we cannot walk alone.
sentences.chinese: 在寻求和平与真理的道路上，我们不能踽踽独行。

sentences.english: This is their world back traveled alone, you do not really feel bad I thought.
sentences.chinese: 背这自己的世界踽踽独行，你都没想过真的心疼我。

sentences.english: If you've ever seen a one-legged dog then you've seen me.
sentences.chinese: 你可曾见过一条在街上踽踽独行的瘸狗么？

sentences.english: Walking with a friend in the dark is better than walking alone in the light.
sentences.chinese: 与友相伴，暗夜而行，胜过日光之下踽踽独行。

definition: to tread/to tramp/to loiter/to hover around
lit. a lonely body with only a shadow for company/to be all alone (idiom)
to pace back and forth/to hesitate/to be indecisive
to be alone/to stand in isolation
lit. bleak wind and icy rain (idiom)/fig. hardships/miserable circumstances
with only body and shadow to comfort each other (idiom)/extremely sad and lonely
variant of 踟躕|踟蹰[chi2 chu2]
